author: Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001
Teoderick Contreras, Splunk
description: Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001: The following analytic detects the installation of a Linux kernel module using the modprobe utility. It leverages data from Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) agents, focusing on process names and command-line executions. This activity is significant because installing a kernel module can indicate an attempt to deploy a rootkit or other malicious kernel-level code, potentially leading to elevated privileges and bypassing security detections. If confirmed malicious, this could allow an attacker to gain persistent, high-level access to the system, compromising its integrity and security.
false_positives: Administrator or network operator can execute this command. Please update the filter macros to remove false positives.
name: Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001: Linux Install Kernel Module Using Modprobe Utility
note: Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001: This rule was converted from Splunk SPL to Elastic EQL.
query:
sequence by host.hostname
  [process where event.type == "start" and process.name in ("kmod", "sudo") and process.args : "modprobe"]
  [process where event.type == "start" and process.name == "modprobe"]
